Articles.Content:
Just wanted to say hello. Having a lot of fun with the game, although it seems to be a rather steep learning curve getting started (while acknowledging that it is in early release). I (and my new BFF named 'youtube tutorials') managed to get a space station up/started 2 days ago and dropped a sky crane on the moon to deploy my first rover (sky crane now being too out of gas to make it back to orbit to refuel, so I guess that's where the moon-base goes .

One question so far: I've been trying to figure out how to return the kerbals I send out on missions back to the astronaut complex. I want to make them available for a new mission. I assume I need to return them to the planet, but don't know how to stick them back in the complex when I've done that. Do I just need to get them close enough to the space center? Am I missing a hot-key? Is it even possible yet for this stage of game development?

Thank you very much,

khamles

One question so far: I've been trying to figure out how to return the kerbals I send out on missions back to the astronaut complex. I want to make them available for a new mission. I assume I need to return them to the planet, but don't know how to stick them back in the complex when I've done that. Do I just need to get them close enough to the space center? Am I missing a hot-key? Is it even possible yet for this stage of game development?

You need to go the tracking station and click on the flight you want to return Kerbals from once it has landed on Kerbin. Then you can click the recover button to get the Kerbals back.

Oh, and welcome to the forums!

Happy Launching!

Arrr!

Capt'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

*whisper* does he always do that? is he a bot? Hmm...
